001 
002
003/**
004 * Class CommandWords - Holds an enumeration table of all command words known to the game.
005 * It is used to recognise commands as they are typed in.
006 *
007 * This class is part of the "World of Zuul" application. 
008 * "World of Zuul" is a very simple, text based adventure game.  
009 * 
010 *
011 * @author  Michael Kolling and David J. Barnes + D.Bureau
012 * @version 2008.03.30 + 2019.09.25
013 */
014public class CommandWords
015{
016    // ### Attributes ###
017
018    // a constant array that will hold all valid command words
019    private final String[] aValidCommands;
020
021    // ### Constructor ###
022    
023    /**
024     * Constructor - initialise the command words.
025     */
026    public CommandWords()
027    {
028        this.aValidCommands = new String[14];
029        this.aValidCommands[0] = "go";
030        this.aValidCommands[1] = "look";
031        this.aValidCommands[2] = "help";
032        this.aValidCommands[3] = "quit";
033        this.aValidCommands[4] = "eat";
034        this.aValidCommands[5] = "back";
035        this.aValidCommands[6] = "test";
036        this.aValidCommands[7] = "take";
037        this.aValidCommands[8] = "drop";
038        this.aValidCommands[9] = "inventory";
039        this.aValidCommands[10] = "fire";
040        this.aValidCommands[11] = "charge";
041        this.aValidCommands[12] = "use";
042        this.aValidCommands[13] = "win";
043    } // CommandWords()
044    
045    // ### Getter ###
046    
047    /**
048     * Prints all valid commands to System.out.
049     * 
050     * @return A list of all the valid commands.
051    */
052    public String getCommandList()
053    {
054        String vCommandList = "";
055        for(String vCommand : this.aValidCommands)
056        {
057            vCommandList += (vCommand + " ");
058        }
059        return vCommandList;
060    } // showAll()
061    
062    // ### Other Methods ###
063    
064    /**
065     * Check whether a given String is a valid command word. 
066     * 
067     * @param pString Command to be checked.
068     * 
069     * @return true if a given string is a valid command,
070     * false if it isn't.
071     */
072    public boolean isCommand( final String pString )
073    {
074        for ( int vI=0; vI<this.aValidCommands.length; vI++ ) {
075            if ( this.aValidCommands[vI].equals( pString ) )
076                return true;
077        } // for
078        // if we get here, the string was not found in the commands :
079        return false;
080    } // isCommand()
081} // CommandWords
